spec.name: Serdab Synagogue
spec.description: Serdab Synagogue (Synagogue Serdab) is a historical place of worship for Casablanca's Jewish community, located near the Old Medina. The term 'Serdab' refers to a cool, subterranean room, suggesting the synagogue may have had unique structural features. It is a vital remnant of the once-flourishing Jewish presence in the city, contributing to Morocco's history of religious pluralism.

timeline.title: Establishment Period
timeline.description: The synagogue was established during the height of the Jewish community's growth (Approximate date).

access.comment: Access is restricted, primarily serving the Jewish community; tourists often require prior arrangement.
